metadata.synopsis:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.

12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
12.text: I rather suspected I'd die in a sunless hole. Just not this one.

13.speaker: Oskar Fevras
13.context: NodeContext: Polited but panicked - he's a hostage and by talking to him, we risk making his captors angry

81.speaker: Garias
81.text: Oi! Leave him be, yeah? You've got an appointment with Zarys - and she don't like waiting.

69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
69.text: I'm far too busy to speak. Goodbye!
69.context: NodeContext: Pretending all is well, really trying to get rid of us

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Why do you think I'm going to die?

42.speaker: Oskar Fevras
42.context: NodeContext: Shocked that we know what he was thinking

198.speaker: Oskar Fevras
198.text: Look, whatever you planned with Rugan, they know. Be ready for anything.
198.context: NodeContext: Hushed tones - he's giving us a warning and trying not to get caught

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Discern the source of his unease.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *His eyes are glassy, and he is sweating profusely - absolutely terrified, but pretending all is well.*

184.speaker: Narrator
184.text: *There's little to discern- aside from his obvious desire to be left alone.*

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Relax. I'm just here to trade.

70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
70.text: No, not trade - trap. Prove you're more useful alive.
70.context: NodeContext: Hushed through gritted teeth and a fixed smile - he's trying to warn you without getting caught

110.speaker: Oskar Fevras
110.text: Quite. Now I really do have to get back to work!
110.context: NodeContext: Nodding along, panicked, loud, and clearly not listening. Just wants us to move on.

107.speaker: Oskar Fevras
107.context: NodeContext: Repeated in a hushed panic - what's going on underneath the surface as he tries to pretend you're not walking into a trap.

23.speaker: Oskar Fevras
23.text: It's pure savagery, to keep a prisoner parched like this. They'll only offer me water.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Your jailor is dead - you're free to go.

75.speaker: Oskar Fevras
75.text: He's what? Pardon... I won't miss him. But Brem was about as reasonable as these thugs get.
75.context: NodeContext: First part a dismayed outburst, quickly realising he's being ungrateful and explaining his dismay that we've killrd Brem.

28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
28.text: He might've let me go, for the right amount of coin. The rest? They'll only be swayed by steel.
28.context: NodeContext: Hinting to us that we'll need to kill the Zhent to free him.

47.speaker: Oskar Fevras
47.text: You! The way you handled Zarys - you're not one of her thugs.
47.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, first meeting with the player.NodeContext: Hushed tone, trying to be subtle

171.speaker: Oskar Fevras
171.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious, with full intent - he feels no need to explain

112.speaker: Oskar Fevras
112.text: I am not some lower city coinlad offering you a tumble. I am an artist.

71.speaker: Oskar Fevras
71.text: And my patron will reward you for my rescue - tenfold whatever ransom you pay, I guarantee it.
71.context: NodeContext: Hammering home the point that we'd be foolish not to help him

174.speaker: Oskar Fevras
174.text: Then it is well I am asking you to serve only yourself.
174.context: NodeContext: Annoyed by our assumption that he was a servant, but steering us back on topic

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Sure - how much do you cost?

11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
11.text: You were... rather quick to agree. But all the wiser for it.
11.context: NodeContext: He's just begged us to buy him but blinks and hesitates at how quickly we said yes. Regains his composure and fake warmth in second sentence

170.speaker: Oskar Fevras
170.text: For the return of her prize artist, my patron will measure her gratitude in gold.
170.context: NodeContext: describing something of great value to someone he believes easily duped

123.speaker: Oskar Fevras
123.text: Tenfold whatever ransom these clods try to squeeze from you, I guarantee it.

38.speaker: Oskar Fevras
38.text: As far as you're concerned she may as well be the Coinmaiden herself.
38.context: NodeContext: Arrogant, brushing away our concerns of his patron's means

49.speaker: Oskar Fevras
49.text: But there will be time for questions later. Please, speak to Brem - I need to see the sun again.
49.context: NodeContext: Steering us back on topic, feeling very sorry for himself

183.speaker: Player
183.text: I'll see how much they're asking for you.

181.speaker: Oskar Fevras
181.text: I hope you have means - these Zhent have seen my work. They won't let me go cheaply.
181.context: NodeContext: Sizing us up - he knows he's valuable and we don't look like we can afford him - but are his only hope

157.speaker: Oskar Fevras
157.text: Please, speak to Brem. I need to see the sun again.
157.context: NodeContext: Steering us back on topic, feeling very sorry for himself

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Forget it. I just want you to paint my portrait.

143.speaker: Oskar Fevras
143.context: NodeContext: Losing his patience for a moment - 'stlarn' is a DnD equivalent of 'fuck/fucking'

189.speaker: Oskar Fevras
189.text: Forgive me, but I can't think down here. Can't work. Free me, and you will have your portrait.
189.context: NodeContext: Regaining his composure, explaining away his ambush and trying to be nice

14.speaker: Oskar Fevras
14.text: One so grand that even blind Tyr himself will weep to see it - but first, speak to Brem. Please.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I doubt you're worth the asking price.

87.speaker: Oskar Fevras
87.text: Fine - as well as a mere fortune, I will offer you something far greater: a painting by my own hand.
87.context: NodeContext: Maintaing his patience at the fact that a huge reward in gold was apparently not enough for us

135.speaker: Oskar Fevras
135.text: I'll make of you a portrait so grand that even blind Tyr will weep in its very presence.
135.context: NodeContext: Earnest, promising that we'll get exactly what we want 'Tyr' = TEAR, god of justice

56.speaker: Oskar Fevras
56.text: Just as soon as I'm back in the city. Please, speak to Brem - I need to see the sun again.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: This ransom is your patron's problem - not mine.

55.speaker: Oskar Fevras
55.text: And when my corpse is being picked at by dogs, I suppose it won't be your problem then either?
55.context: NodeContext: Dramatic at how heartless we're being

91.speaker: Oskar Fevras
91.text: I took you for a better sort than these. Leave me to my chains, then.
91.context: NodeContext: Disgusted with us - he's been arrogant and rude, but how could we turn down helping him

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Maybe. But you don't look very expensive.

164.speaker: Oskar Fevras
164.text: Not to you, perhaps - but those of actual taste might disagree.
164.context: NodeContext: Annoyed by our rudeness, returning it in kind

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Buy you? I'm just here to have my portrait painted.

115.speaker: Oskar Fevras
115.text: You... oh. Another of Brem's bloody commissions? I will not sully my brush with every ugly vagrant who -
115.context: NodeContext: Initially confused, then realising - his captor has sent us over to have him paint our likeness. He has no interest and considers it a waste of his talent

93.speaker: Oskar Fevras
93.text: Forgive me, I just... I'm here against my will, you see? But I know my patron is looking.
93.context: NodeContext: Trying to rein in his temper - surely we'll see sense if he explains his predicament

182.speaker: Oskar Fevras
182.text: She will be most grateful to whoever can secure my release. And most generous, I know it.
182.context: NodeContext: Wink wink nod nod - we have the means to make money and powerful friends here

84.speaker: Oskar Fevras
84.text: Gods above - I said buy me. If you didn't have the coin, you might have just said.
84.context: InternalNodeContext: The player entered the camp peacefully. Then they murdered all the zhents.NodeContext: Taking in a scene of carnage - he asked us to bribe his captors and instead we slaughtered them. Distaste at our methods

66.speaker: Oskar Fevras
66.text: In any case, I am a slave no longer - and your money troubles are over, rest assured. For you have saved none other than Oskar Fevras.
66.context: NodeContext: As if we should be the ones honoured to meet him

86.speaker: Oskar Fevras
86.text: I can't say I've ever been bought before - how much did I fetch?
86.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been bought by the player to the Zhent. The situation is still supposedly peacefull.NodeContext: Mildly scandalised, conspiratorial

191.speaker: Oskar Fevras
191.text: No, don't tell me. There is nothing so depressing as learning one's true value.
191.context: NodeContext: Dismissing, moving on - making an astute observation about himself. He's an ass but he's self-aware

94.speaker: Oskar Fevras
94.text: Well, you should at least know what you've paid for. I am the Oskar Fevras, at your service.
94.context: NodeContext: Mock formality, as if addressing someone who's going to recognise his name

82.speaker: Oskar Fevras
82.text: An affliction for which you cannot be faulted, this far from civilisation.

152.speaker: Oskar Fevras
152.text: But my patron will be most grateful for your heroics. My betrothed, I should say.
152.context: NodeContext: Promising great reward. The second line is almost as if he's unpleasantly reminding himself that he's engaged. He does love this woman, but she's overbearing

179.speaker: Oskar Fevras
179.text: A genuine pleasure. I'm in your debt - as is my patron. My betrothed, I should say.
179.context: NodeContext: Warm. He's over the top, but being quite sincere here.

18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
18.text: Assuming Lady Jannath still wishes to marry after our little... falling out.
18.context: NodeContext: Wincing, recalling a bitter argument

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You recall a recent scandal - a patriar of Baldur's Gate who wished to marry a commoner.*

1.speaker: Oskar Fevras
1.text: I did not run away - a date was never set. There were... complications.
1.context: NodeContext: Indignant, an accusation that's been levelled at him before

7.speaker: Oskar Fevras
7.text: Before my fame, my patron, there was... another woman. One I planned to spend my life with.
7.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, reflective - he's thinking back on a time when he was poor and anonymous, but happy in a humble life with a woman he loved

133.speaker: Oskar Fevras
133.text: But when Lady Jannath offered me a future, well... it felt only right to mention my past.
133.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

118.speaker: Oskar Fevras
118.text: Right, but unwise. I was forced to retreat into the countryside. To paint, and clear my head. To choose, I suppose.
118.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

111.speaker: Player
111.text: And what choice did you make?

202.speaker: Oskar Fevras
202.text: Assuming Lady Jannath still wishes to marry after our little... falling out.
202.context: NodeContext: Wincing, recalling a bitter argument

88.speaker: Oskar Fevras
88.text: She offered me a future, and so in a fit of madness I told her of my past.
88.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

89.speaker: Oskar Fevras
89.text: Of the woman I'd loved before she found me. Love still, in truth. She was... less than pleased.
89.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, reflective - he's thinking back on a time when he was poor and anonymous, but happy in a humble life with a woman he loved

98.speaker: Oskar Fevras
98.text: A noblewoman of passion, refinement and, as it turns out, quite ferocious temper.
98.context: NodeContext: Listing admirable qualities of the noblewoman to whom he is engaged

65.speaker: Oskar Fevras
65.text: The latter I learned only after the engagement, when I told her I was in love with someone else.
65.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

20.speaker: Oskar Fevras
20.text: I made a timely retreat into the countryside. To paint, and clear my head. To choose, I suppose.

148.speaker: Oskar Fevras
148.text: Indeed - one to split the very soul. But I dare not dwell on it any longer lest I weep.
148.context: NodeContext: Knows he's being mocked but continues on sincerely nonetheless

99.speaker: Oskar Fevras
99.text: And we have your reward to consider - once I have made my way safely back to the city.
99.context: NodeContext: Allowing himself to be steered back on topic, firmly assuring us he needs to get back safely before we can be paid

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I saw your paintings - were they portraits of the women you spoke of?

169.speaker: Oskar Fevras
169.text: Indeed. I thought the canvas would make clear what my heart could not.
169.context: NodeContext: Fake humble - he knows his paintings are good, and assumes we're a fan too

27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
27.text: Both turned out masterpieces, more's the pity. Not a stray brushstroke between them.
27.context: NodeContext: Bitter at his own incredible talent - how unlucky for him

154.speaker: Oskar Fevras
154.text: They're yours, if you can find use for them - in the privy perhaps. I had best get moving.

144.speaker: Oskar Fevras
144.text: Then I congratulate you - tear them up and they'll be most useful in the privy.

62.speaker: Oskar Fevras
62.text: I thought the canvas would make clear what my heart could not. Drivel.

80.speaker: Oskar Fevras
80.text: Now, if you cared to spare some coins in exchange, well. That would ease the discomforts of the road some.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I hope you came to a decision - the paintings are gone.

158.speaker: Oskar Fevras
158.text: Wadded up to wipe Zhentish arses, I expect - and good riddance.

22.speaker: Oskar Fevras
22.text: Their objective perfection is what caught these bastards' eyes to begin with. Now that I'm free...

24.speaker: Oskar Fevras
24.text: Say - I don't suppose you could spare some coin, could you? Ease the discomforts of the road some?
24.context: NodeContext: Chancing his arm = we've already gone to great lengths to help him, but he accepts this as rtreatment befitting someone of his station

57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
57.text: No coin? Mightily imprudent of you.
57.context: NodeContext: Aghast - how could we be so irresponsible? Never mind the fact that we've just paid all our money to free him in the first place

173.speaker: Oskar Fevras
173.text: A hero to the hilt. Seek me out in the city, truly - beneath my brush, you'll live forever.
173.context: NodeContext: Complimentary, grateful for our help but also asking as if he never expected anything else.

19.speaker: Oskar Fevras
19.context: NodeContext: Wamly, as if genuinely looking forward to it. Cheerful

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I've already spent enough coin on you.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Coin will just weigh you down. Get moving.

127.speaker: Oskar Fevras
127.text: I suppose I can endure the walk sober. Suffering has become an old friend, after all.
127.context: NodeContext: Somewhat put out - the burdens he must carry

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I'll give you a serious discomfort to deal with if you don't get going. Now.

83.speaker: Oskar Fevras
83.text: Right you are, just asking for a little help was all...
83.context: NodeContext: Immediately retreating from the slightest sign of temper

178.speaker: Oskar Fevras
178.context: NodeContext: Done with us and keen to move on - yes we've saved him and he is very grateful, but he has things to be doing

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I must know how this tragic tale ends. What option did you choose?

60.speaker: Oskar Fevras
60.text: Hm? Oh, absolutely none. Fame and wealth suit me very well, no doubt.
60.context: NodeContext: As if we've asked a question he hadn't considered - then very casually saying he's come to no decision at all

122.speaker: Oskar Fevras
122.text: And yet I think of that first love, and... I hesitate. Likely I'm going mad.
122.context: NodeContext: Honestly reflective, quietly laughing at himself - he's being offered fame and riches, and he finds himself hesitating for reasons he can't even explain

190.speaker: Oskar Fevras
190.text: Regardless! We have more immediate concerns - your reward once I've returned to the city, for one.
190.context: NodeContext: Pulling himself out of reverie, briskly back to business

51.speaker: Player
51.text: All I care about is getting paid.

117.speaker: Oskar Fevras
117.text: I wish I could harden my heart so. Still, you're right - we have the matter of my return to consider.
117.context: NodeContext: Chiding, as if we're heartless for not caring about his predicament - but moving quickly back to business

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I don't care about your love life - I just want my reward.

155.speaker: Oskar Fevras
155.text: Ah. Right. Suit yourself - find me in the city and you shall have your reward.
155.context: NodeContext: He had been ready to tell us the grand drama of his life, assuming we'd want to hear - and is somewhat taken aback when we cut him off

4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
4.text: Say - you couldn't spare a little coin, could you? Ease the discomforts of the road some?
4.context: NodeContext: Deep down knows he's chancing his arm, but framing it as a reasonable request

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Ah, patrons dallying with their dashing artisans. A tale as old as art itself.

166.speaker: Oskar Fevras
166.text: Quite. It seems we are destined to doomed romances, are we not?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: My slaves do not speak until they are spoken to.

149.speaker: Oskar Fevras
149.text: Ha! Quite. Well, now that... wait, you're not serious?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I don't make jokes with my slaves.

74.speaker: Oskar Fevras
74.text: Indeed. I'll just... carry your things then, shall I? Scrub your boots? Just one moment.

16.speaker: Oskar Fevras
16.text: You can SHOVE your boots where even Lathander can't light - I'm no one's slave!

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Of course I'm not. Just teasing.

77.speaker: Oskar Fevras
77.text: Droll. Fear not, I'll ensure you're compensated once I return to my patron. My betrothed, I should say.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Excellent. When will I get my reward?

48.speaker: Oskar Fevras
48.text: Fear not, friend! My patron will make good on all my debts. My betrothed, I should say.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Don't worry, 'the Oskar Fevras' didn't cost me a single coin.

63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
63.text: ... do you know, of all the indignities heaped upon me in this place, that might well be the worst.
63.context: NodeContext: Air of tragic self-pity: after being taken as a hostage, he wasn't even ransomed for a proper price

0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
0.text: It seems you've made quite the profit. My patron will see you rewarded - my betrothed, I should say.
0.context: NodeContext: Brisk, back to matter at hand

159.speaker: Player
159.text: What will you do with your freedom?

31.speaker: Oskar Fevras
31.text: Oh - run crying back to my patron I expect. My betrothed, I should say.

92.speaker: Oskar Fevras
92.text: Oh, my friend. There are far more interesting folk to speak to here.
92.context: NodeContext: Polite but panicked - he's a hostage and by talking to him, we risk making his captors angry

124.speaker: Oskar Fevras
124.text: You! Zarys may have welcomed you, but I can see you're not one of her thugs.
124.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, first meeting with the player.NodeContext: Hushed tone, trying to be subtle

125.speaker: Oskar Fevras
125.text: Excuse me, but I really am far too busy.

197.speaker: Oskar Fevras
197.context: NodeContext: Smiling throught terror. Second line emphatic

139.speaker: Oskar Fevras
139.text: Wait, WAIT! I'm just a prisoner - spare me and there'll be coin, I swear it!
139.context: InternalNodeContext: The player entered the camp peacefully. Then they murdered all the zhents.NodeContext: Panicked, he just saw us kill a lot of people and thinks we're about to kill him

15.speaker: Oskar Fevras
15.text: I'm an artist. These faithless bastards were trying to ransom me back to my patron.
15.context: NodeContext: Relating his story, trying to get it out

120.speaker: Oskar Fevras
120.text: She's a woman of great means - and great generosity to those who serve her well.
120.context: NodeContext: Warming to the task now that we're listening - he's in control

44.speaker: Oskar Fevras
44.text: Heroes who rescue her prize painter, for example. Oskar Fevras, at your service.
44.context: NodeContext: As if we should be honoured

147.speaker: Oskar Fevras
147.text: Oh, thank the gods - if it's wealth you seek then you've done yourself a great service, friend.
147.context: NodeContext: Relieved - he thought we were going to kill him, but now that he knows we can be bought he's in control again

39.speaker: Oskar Fevras
39.text: Oh, thank the gods. You may not know it, friend, but you've just done yourself a great service indeed.
39.context: NodeContext: Relieved - he thought we were going to kill him, but now that he knows we can be bought he's in control again

134.speaker: Oskar Fevras
134.text: For you've rescued none other than the artist Oskar Fevras.

145.speaker: Oskar Fevras
145.text: I can't say I've ever been bought before - how much did I fetch?
145.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been bought by the player to the Zhent. The situation is still supposedly peacefull.NodeContext: Mildly scandalised, conspiratorial

180.speaker: Oskar Fevras
180.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
180.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

188.speaker: Oskar Fevras
188.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

186.speaker: Oskar Fevras
186.context: NodeContext: Aghast - he joked about us killing him and we took it seriously

8.speaker: Oskar Fevras
8.context: NodeContext: Realising we might be dangerous psycopaths, moderating his tone to politeness. 'No thank you I would not like you to kill me.'

196.speaker: Oskar Fevras
196.text: You've spoken to Brem? He'll let me go free?
196.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I've got enough problems without adding you to the list.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Not yet. I'm working on it.

53.speaker: Oskar Fevras
53.text: Of course. I don't mean to rush you.

199.speaker: Oskar Fevras
199.text: I'm sure we have plenty of time before they work me to death.
199.context: NodeContext: Dramatic and passive aggressive - it's just his precious life in the balance
